translated: Sound is permanent because of being audible.

original: mnyan bya min pa mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: mnyan bya min pa mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: The inaudible is seen to be impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin zhes chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi dpe 'di yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin zhes chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi dpe 'di yod pa kho na'o //
translated: just like a pot. This example of dissimilarity is only present.

original: de las kyang rtag pa nyid grub par @309a * //
analyzed: de las kyang rtag pa nyid grub par @309a * //
translated: And from that, permanence is established.

original: 'gyur ro // 'di 'dra bas ni zhes pa /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // 'di 'dra bas ni zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúBy this kind of‚Äù means

original: 'di 'dra ba ni gang gis gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun phyogs bsgrub bya'i mi mthun phyogs kho na la yod par bstan par bya ba khyod kyi chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi sbyor bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ni gang gis gtan tshigs kyi mi mthun phyogs bsgrub bya'i mi mthun phyogs kho na la yod par bstan par bya ba khyod kyi chos mi mthun pa nyid kyi sbyor bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: this kind of is that which is to be shown to be the reason‚Äôs discordant class, the probandum‚Äôs discordant class only. Your example of dissimilarity is the application you assert.

original: de 'dra bas ni glog rtag ste /
analyzed: de 'dra bas ni glog rtag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy this kind of‚Äù means that lightning is permanent

original: rtsol ma thag tu ma byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa 'di sgrub byed du skyon med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsol ma thag tu ma byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa 'di sgrub byed du skyon med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because of not occurring immediately after effort. This proof is faultless.

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How so? He says:

original: rtsol ma thag tu ma byung ba ni mthong zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ma thag tu ma byung ba ni mthong zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The non-arising of the effect immediately after the effort is the seeing, etc.

original: gtan tshigs med pa kho na pha rol pos brtsad pa zhes pa skye ba las sngar med pa sgrub byed nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya dag khyad par med pa nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs med pa kho na pha rol pos brtsad pa zhes pa skye ba las sngar med pa sgrub byed nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya dag khyad par med pa nyid du brjod de /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs objection that there is no reason is stated, because the non-existence prior to arising is imagined to be the probandum, the reason and the probandum are said to be indistinguishable.

original: pha rol pos gnyis ka dag gtan nas med pa nyid ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: pha rol pos gnyis ka dag gtan nas med pa nyid ma yin zhes so //
translated: The opponent says that neither is utterly non-existent.

original: de ltar na yang gtan tshigs med pa kho nar brtsad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gtan tshigs med pa kho nar brtsad par 'gyur te /
translated: Even so, the objection that there is no reason remains,

original: bsgrub bya las logs par med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya las logs par med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference from the probandum.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log pa nyid med pa'i phyir skyon gzhan du brjod par bya ba'i phyin ci log nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log pa nyid med pa'i phyir skyon gzhan du brjod par bya ba'i phyin ci log nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no error, the opponent‚Äôs objection is not erroneous.

original: de bzhin du phrad pa dang ma phrad pa gtan tshigs ma yin par mtshungs pa dag la phyin ci log med pa nyid kyi phyir phyin ci log nyid las skyon gzhan du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phrad pa dang ma phrad pa gtan tshigs ma yin par mtshungs pa dag la phyin ci log med pa nyid kyi phyir phyin ci log nyid las skyon gzhan du brjod par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, since there is no error in the non-erroneous with respect to the similar non-contact and contact, the error should be stated as being due to error itself,

original: gtan tshigs thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all reasons are denied.

original: med pa nyid du rtsod pas phyin ci log tu mngon par brjod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: med pa nyid du rtsod pas phyin ci log tu mngon par brjod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not that the opponent‚Äôs expression of error is due to the dispute about non-existence.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi snga ma'i phyogs smra pas shes par byed pa gtan tshigs su brjod cing /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi snga ma'i phyogs smra pas shes par byed pa gtan tshigs su brjod cing /
translated: Although that is so, the proponent of the former position states the reason as the proof,

original: pha rol gyi byed pa por sgro btags nas sun 'byin to //
analyzed: pha rol gyi byed pa por sgro btags nas sun 'byin to //
translated: and refutes the opponent‚Äôs superimposition of the agent.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log tu brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log tu brjod de /
translated: Therefore, the error is stated.

original: shes byed kyi rgyu las bzlog par rtsod pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: shes byed kyi rgyu las bzlog par rtsod pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because the reason for the proof is disputed as being the opposite,

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: therefore it is said:

original: 'di yang ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is also not so.‚Äù

original: 'di yang ltag chod smra ba pos /
analyzed: 'di yang ltag chod smra ba pos /
translated: This is also the proponent of the reductio.

original: dam bca'i don skyed pa la byed pa po'i rgyu la skyon smras pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dam bca'i don skyed pa la byed pa po'i rgyu la skyon smras pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of the promise is not that the fault is in the causal agent of production,

original: 'o na ci zhen /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhen /
translated: but rather,

original: shes par byed pa'i rgyu kho na la'o //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i rgyu kho na la'o //
translated: in the cause that makes known.

original: ci las she na /
analyzed: ci las she na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: gang gi phyir de la yang ste shes par byed pa la phrad par bya ba ma phrad pa na skyon 'brel pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang ste shes par byed pa la phrad par bya ba ma phrad pa na skyon 'brel pa kho na ste /
translated: Because even in that, i.e., in the cause that makes known, when there is no contact with what is to be contacted, there is only the fault of non-connection.

original: gal te gtan tshigs 'di phrad nas sgrub par byed pa na /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs 'di phrad nas sgrub par byed pa na /
translated: If this reason is an establisher through contact,

original: bsgrub bya dang khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pas gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pas gang bshad pa'o //
translated: then it would be no different from the probandum.

original: dmigs pa mtshungs @309b ba yang zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa mtshungs @309b ba yang zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: As for ‚Äúthe same objective support,‚Äù etc.,

original: pha rol pos 'di mi rtag pa nyid la gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol pos 'di mi rtag pa nyid la gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: the opponent says, ‚ÄúThis is not a reason for impermanence,

original: glog pa la sogs pa mngon sum nyid la sogs pa gzhan las mi rtag par 'grub pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: glog pa la sogs pa mngon sum nyid la sogs pa gzhan las mi rtag par 'grub pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa na /
translated: because lightning, etc., are established as impermanent by other means, such as direct perception.‚Äù

original: rtsong pa bsgrub par bshad pa /
analyzed: rtsong pa bsgrub par bshad pa /
translated: The response is the explanation of the proof.

original: 'di skad rtsol ma thag tu byung ba nyid kho nas mi rtag pa nyid 'grub kyi rnam pa gzhan du ma yin zhes nged mi smra'i /
analyzed: 'di skad rtsol ma thag tu byung ba nyid kho nas mi rtag pa nyid 'grub kyi rnam pa gzhan du ma yin zhes nged mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that impermanence is established in any other way than by the mere fact of its arising immediately after exertion.üîΩIf there is another proof, we are pleased.

original: de gal te shes par byed pa gzhan yang yod na dga' bar byed do zhes pas 'di phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: de gal te shes par byed pa gzhan yang yod na dga' bar byed do zhes pas 'di phyin ci log yin te /
translated: This is a misrepresentation, because

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes brjod par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa kho na'o zhes brjod par 'dod pa na /
translated: when we assert that it is impermanent because it arises immediately after exertion,

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kho na'i phyir mi rtag go zhes sgro btags pa'i phyir zhe'o //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kho na'i phyir mi rtag go zhes sgro btags pa'i phyir zhe'o //
translated: we are misrepresenting the opponent‚Äôs position by saying that he asserts that it is impermanent because it arises immediately after exertion.

original: 'di las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di las gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: 'di yang phyin ci log ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang phyin ci log ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not a misrepresentation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why? It is said:

original: pha rol pos 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol pos 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The opponent does not say this.üîΩWhy?

original: gang gi phyir pha rol pos 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid la gtan tshigs gzhan yang yod do zhes brtsad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol pos 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid la gtan tshigs gzhan yang yod do zhes brtsad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The opponent does not argue that there is another reason for impermanence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What does he say?

original: 'khrul par bstan pas gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: 'khrul par bstan pas gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid du brjod de /
translated: Since it is shown to be mistaken, it is said to be not a logical reason.

original: 'di med na yang bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i phyir 'di gtan tshigs ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: 'di med na yang bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i phyir 'di gtan tshigs ma yin zhes so //
translated: Because the thesis is established even if it does not exist, this is not a logical reason.

original: de 'khrul par ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de 'khrul par ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: The statement that shows it to be mistaken is:

original: de de'i ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de de'i ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not that.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'di lan du 'gyur ro zhes pa gal te de ma thag tu brjod pa'i rnam pas gtan tshigs ma yin par brjod na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di lan du 'gyur ro zhes pa gal te de ma thag tu brjod pa'i rnam pas gtan tshigs ma yin par brjod na'o //
translated: Thus, this is the response: If it is said that the logical reason is not established in the way just stated,

original: gzhan du na sgra mi rtag ste brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i phyogs snga ma 'di las phyogs gzhan brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na sgra mi rtag ste brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i phyogs snga ma 'di las phyogs gzhan brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: otherwise, it would be stating a different position from the opponent‚Äôs position, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it arises only when effort is exerted.‚Äù

original: glog la sogs pa rnams mi rtag ste mig gis gzung bya nyid kyi phyir zhes so //
analyzed: glog la sogs pa rnams mi rtag ste mig gis gzung bya nyid kyi phyir zhes so //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúLightning and so on are impermanent because they are apprehended by the eye.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir sun 'byin par snang ba med pa'i phyir ltag chod kyi lan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sun 'byin par snang ba med pa'i phyir ltag chod kyi lan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is no apparent refutation, it is not a fallacious rejoinder.

original: gnyis pa la yang gtan tshigs phyin ci log ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang gtan tshigs phyin ci log ma yin no //
translated: In the second case, the logical reason is not erroneous.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir de la gtan tshigs ma khyab pa nyid kho nar brtsad kyi /üîΩphyin ci log cung zad bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan nye bar bkod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la gtan tshigs ma khyab pa nyid kho nar brtsad kyi / phyin ci log cung zad bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan nye bar bkod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the opponent disputes only the pervasion of the reason,üîΩbut does not posit another reason that slightly reverses the error.

original: the tshom mtshungs pa yang gang gis gtan tshigs phyin ci log nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba pha rol pos gtan tshigs phyin ci log tu brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: the tshom mtshungs pa yang gang gis gtan tshigs phyin ci log nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba pha rol pos gtan tshigs phyin ci log tu brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The opponent does not state a reason that is erroneous because of being similar to doubt.

original: 'o na ci zhe na bsgrub bya dang gtan tshigs sgro btags pa ste /üîΩskye ba can ni bsgrub bya nyid du sgro btags nas dang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba @310a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na bsgrub bya dang gtan tshigs sgro btags pa ste / skye ba can ni bsgrub bya nyid du sgro btags nas dang brtsal ma thag tu byung ba @310a * //
translated: Rather, the reason and the probandum are imputed.üîΩHaving imputed the probandum, that which arises,

original: yang gtan tshigs nyid du ste /
analyzed: yang gtan tshigs nyid du ste /
translated: the reason is also imputed, that which arises immediately upon exertion.

original: dgra zlar gnas par byas pa'o //
analyzed: dgra zlar gnas par byas pa'o //
translated: Having made them adversaries,

original: de ltar gyur na ci las gtan tshigs phyin ci log pa nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ci las gtan tshigs phyin ci log pa nyid du 'gyur bar 'dod /
translated: if that is the case, from what is the reason considered to be erroneous?

original: dam bca' ba phyin ci log tu brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba phyin ci log tu brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the thesis is stated in error,

original: lan phyin ci log go //
analyzed: lan phyin ci log go //
translated: the response is erroneous.

original: de ltar ni sgra mi rtag go zhes dam bca' pa na /
analyzed: de ltar ni sgra mi rtag go zhes dam bca' pa na /
translated: Thus, when one asserts, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent,‚Äù

original: pha rol pos brjod pa /
analyzed: pha rol pos brjod pa /
translated: the opponent says,

original: bskyed par bya ba ni rtag go zhes pa de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba ni rtag go zhes pa de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe produced is permanent.‚Äù Therefore, it is said,

original: dam bca' ba phyin ci log pas kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba phyin ci log pas kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if the thesis is reversed, and so on.‚Äù

original: gal te dam bca' ba bzlog pas brjod pa na phyin ci log pa nyid du rtog na /
analyzed: gal te dam bca' ba bzlog pas brjod pa na phyin ci log pa nyid du rtog na /
translated: If, when the thesis is reversed, it is conceived to be erroneous,

original: de ltar gyur na thams cad phyin ci log nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na thams cad phyin ci log nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: then in that case, it follows that everything is erroneous.

original: don gyis go ba mtshungs pa la sogs pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gyis go ba mtshungs pa la sogs pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it follows that even in the case of similar understanding of the meaning, and so on,

original: dam bca' phyin ci log pa kho nas dgra zlar gnas par ro //
analyzed: dam bca' phyin ci log pa kho nas dgra zlar gnas par ro //
translated: the opponent remains in opposition only because of the erroneous thesis.

original: de las phyin ci log nyid tsam skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las phyin ci log nyid tsam skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The mere error would be the fault.

original: ma brjod pa mtshungs pa la yang zhes pa la sogs pa ltag chod smra ba pos brjod pa las sngar gtan tshigs med pas bsgrub bya med par thal 'gyur byas te /
analyzed: ma brjod pa mtshungs pa la yang zhes pa la sogs pa ltag chod smra ba pos brjod pa las sngar gtan tshigs med pas bsgrub bya med par thal 'gyur byas te /
translated: The sophist says, ‚ÄúEven in the case of the same unexpressed,‚Äù and so on. Before the reason is stated, it follows that the probandum does not exist.

original: gal te brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa gtan tshigs 'di las sgra mi rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa gtan tshigs 'di las sgra mi rtag pa yin na /
translated: If you say that sound is impermanent because it arises only when sought, then this reason is not established.üîΩ

original: brjod pa las sngar gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ma yin no zhes 'thob ste /
analyzed: brjod pa las sngar gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ma yin no zhes 'thob ste /
translated: If you say that sound is impermanent because it arises only when effort is exerted, then from this reason it follows that sound is not impermanent because prior to expression there is no reason.

original: de'i phyir sngar rnam par yod pa ci ltar mi rtag par byed ces so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar rnam par yod pa ci ltar mi rtag par byed ces so //
translated: Therefore, how can it make sound impermanent when it previously existed?

original: 'di la rtsod sgrub byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la rtsod sgrub byed pas smras pa /
translated: In response to this, the proponent of the argument says:

original: 'di ni phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: This is mistaken.

original: gang gi phyir shes par byed pa zhes byas nas gtan tshigs su brjod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes par byed pa zhes byas nas gtan tshigs su brjod kyi /
translated: Because it is called an ‚Äúinformer,‚Äù it is stated as a reason,

original: 'jig par byed pa'o zhes ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa'o zhes ni ma yin zhing /
translated: not as a ‚Äúdestroyer.‚Äù

original: ltag chod smra ba pos ni 'jig byed du byas nas sun 'byin pas so zhes so //
analyzed: ltag chod smra ba pos ni 'jig byed du byas nas sun 'byin pas so zhes so //
translated: The proponent of a reductio argument refutes by taking it as a destroyer.

original: 'di la gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: 'di yang gtan tshigs phyin ci log ma yin te zhes so //
analyzed: 'di yang gtan tshigs phyin ci log ma yin te zhes so //
translated: This is not a mistaken reason.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Why? It is said:

original: pha rol pos zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol pos zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The opponent...

original: gang gi phyir ltag chod smra ba pos 'jig par byed pa sgra la gtan tshigs so zhes bsams nas tshig las sngar de med pa nyid bshad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ltag chod smra ba pos 'jig par byed pa sgra la gtan tshigs so zhes bsams nas tshig las sngar de med pa nyid bshad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the proponent of the reductio does not explain nonexistence prior to the statement, thinking that the reason is the destruction of sound.

original: 'di ci ltar rtogs par bya zhe na gsungs pa ;
analyzed: 'di ci ltar rtogs par bya zhe na gsungs pa ;
translated: How is this to be understood? It is said:

original: ma gyur cig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma gyur cig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMay it not be so!‚Äù

original: ltag chod smra ba pos ni gtan tshigs brjod pa'i dus su yang /
analyzed: ltag chod smra ba pos ni gtan tshigs brjod pa'i dus su yang /
translated: The proponent of the reductio does not, at the time of stating the reason,

original: sgra mi rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: accept that sound is impermanent.

original: gal te 'jig par byed pa gtan tshigs su yongs su brtags nas de brjod pa las sngar med pa nyid du smras par 'gyur na de ltar @310b na brjod pa'i dus su gtan tshigs de yod do zhes sgra mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di phyin ci
analyzed: gal te 'jig par byed pa gtan tshigs su yongs su brtags nas de brjod pa las sngar med pa nyid du smras par 'gyur na de ltar @310b na brjod pa'i dus su gtan tshigs de yod do zhes sgra mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di phyin ci
translated: If, having imagined destruction to be the reason, he were to state nonexistence prior to the statement of that reason, then at the time of stating it, the reason would exist, and so sound would be impermanent.

original: log ma yin no //
analyzed: log ma yin no //
translated: This is not a misreading.

original: 'bras bu mtshungs pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu mtshungs pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The same result would follow from stating a reason that is not established,üîΩas from stating a reason that is established.

original: gang spyi'i rnam pa des gang byas pa de mi rtag go zhes bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: gang spyi'i rnam pa des gang byas pa de mi rtag go zhes bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: Whatever is produced by that general nature is impermanent.üîΩ

original: bum pa'i 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi dod zlar gnas par byed pa'i phyir 'di phyin ci log pa'o zhes rtsod sgrub byed pas sems so //
analyzed: bum pa'i 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi dod zlar gnas par byed pa'i phyir 'di phyin ci log pa'o zhes rtsod sgrub byed pas sems so //
translated: In the proof that whatever is a product is impermanent, the opponent thinks, This is a fallacy because the qualifier, the effect of the pot, and so on, is being used as the countercorrelate of the generality of the reason.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not correct, because

original: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs phyin ci log tu brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs phyin ci log tu brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: the reason is not being stated in a fallacious way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, Well then, what is it?

original: gtan tshigs 'bras bu'i spyi de kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i khyad par gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'bras bu'i spyi de kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i khyad par gang yin pa des so //
translated: It is the qualifier that is included within the generality of the effect of the reason.

original: de'i nang du 'dus pa kho na phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i nang du 'dus pa kho na phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not that only what is included within that is fallacious.

original: thal 'gyur dang don gyis go ba mtshungs pa la sogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgras de'i rigs can gzhan bsdu'o //
analyzed: thal 'gyur dang don gyis go ba mtshungs pa la sogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgras de'i rigs can gzhan bsdu'o //
translated: Fallacious pervasion, fallacious inference, and so on are not correct, and so on. The words and so on include other similar types.

original: sgra mi rtag ste rgyu mtshan can nyid kyi phyir bum pa bzhin zhes byas ba la /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste rgyu mtshan can nyid kyi phyir bum pa bzhin zhes byas ba la /
translated: Sound is impermanent because of having a cause, like a pot.

original: ltag chod smra ba pos smras pa /
analyzed: ltag chod smra ba pos smras pa /
translated: The one who speaks the reductio says,

original: re zhig bum pa kho na mi rtag ces pa 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhig ces pa 'di la rtsod sgrub byed pas bshad pa 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: re zhig bum pa kho na mi rtag ces pa 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhig ces pa 'di la rtsod sgrub byed pas bshad pa 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'o zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this case, ‚Äòthe pot itself is impermanent‚Äô is the thesis. What is the reason? ‚Äù This is the explanation of the one who engages in debate. He says, ‚ÄúThis is not correct. ‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir na mthong ba'i don yang gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub byar brjod pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na mthong ba'i don yang gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub byar brjod pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Why? ‚Äú Because the meaning of the thesis is also stated as the reason. ‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyis mthong ba'i yang sta /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis mthong ba'i yang sta /
translated: ‚Äú The pot that is seen by oneself

original: rgyu mtshan can gyi bum pa ni shin tu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan can gyi bum pa ni shin tu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes so //
translated: is not a very good reason. ‚Äù

original: 'di la khyad par med pa ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la khyad par med pa ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: Here, to show that there is no difference, he says,

original: 'di la yang phyin ci log ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang phyin ci log ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere, too, it is possible to say that there is a contradiction,üîΩand that there is no difference. ‚Äù

original: de la phyin ci log tu brjod par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log tu brjod par nus pa yin te /
translated: There, it is possible to say that there is a contradiction,

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of the characteristics of a reason.

original: 'gal ba yang ste lhan cig mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ste lhan cig mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: There is also contradiction, because they do not coexist.

original: don gyis go ba mtshungs pa yang de bzhin zhes pa /
analyzed: don gyis go ba mtshungs pa yang de bzhin zhes pa /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe similarity of the understood meaning is also like that‚Äù is as follows.

original: bdag med de ma dmigs pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin zhes byas pa la /
analyzed: bdag med de ma dmigs pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin zhes byas pa la /
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of that selflessness, it is like the son of a barren woman.

original: ltag chod smra ba pos smras pa /
analyzed: ltag chod smra ba pos smras pa /
translated: The sophist says:

original: don gyis nye bar dmigs pa rnams yod pa nyid du 'thob cing /
analyzed: don gyis nye bar dmigs pa rnams yod pa nyid du 'thob cing /
translated: The objects that are apprehended do exist,

original: nye bar dmigs bzhin pa yin yang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa cung zad ni med pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs bzhin pa yin yang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa cung zad ni med pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: and although they are being apprehended, a fire-wheel, etc. is just a little bit nonexistent.

original: 'di yang dag pa ma yin pa'o zhes rtsod sgrub ste /
analyzed: 'di yang dag pa ma yin pa'o zhes rtsod sgrub ste /
translated: This is not correct, he argues,

original: nye bar dmigs pa ni yod pa nyid du rtogs so zhes sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa ni yod pa nyid du rtogs so zhes sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: because the apprehension is the superimposition of existence.

original: 'di la 'dres par ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la 'dres par ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: Here, he teaches the mixture:

original: ji ltar zhes @311a * //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes @311a * //
translated: As it is said,

original: pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: etc.

original: med pa rtag go zhes pa 'di ni 'gal ba ste zhes pa med pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid dag gcig tu mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa rtag go zhes pa 'di ni 'gal ba ste zhes pa med pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid dag gcig tu mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is contradictory, he says, because nonexistence and permanence are not present in one thing.

original: 'di la khyad par med pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la khyad par med pa gsungs pa /
translated: Here, he teaches the absence of distinction:

original: phyin ci log pa yang 'di ste yang dag pa ma yin pa yang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa yang 'di ste yang dag pa ma yin pa yang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: This is erroneous, and it is not correct.

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: yod pa'i don rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa'i don rtag pa nyid kyi phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because the existent object is permanent, etc.

original: gang gi phyir yod pa kho na'i don rtag pa nyid /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa kho na'i don rtag pa nyid /
translated: Because the existent object is permanent.

original: de'i phyir med pa la rtag pa nyid ni phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa la rtag pa nyid ni phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: Therefore, permanence in the nonexistent is erroneous,üîΩbecause it is devoid of the characteristic of permanence.

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gang phyir med pa rtag pa nyid ni mi bden pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gang phyir med pa rtag pa nyid ni mi bden pa ste /
translated: Because the nonexistent is permanent, it is not real.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not real.

original: rtag pa mtshungs pa la yang 'gal bar bshad do //
analyzed: rtag pa mtshungs pa la yang 'gal bar bshad do //
translated: Permanence is the same as contradiction.

original: ci ltar gyur kyang mi rtag pa kho na yin pa de rtag par 'grub par 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: ci ltar gyur kyang mi rtag pa kho na yin pa de rtag par 'grub par 'gyur zhes so //
translated: No matter what happens, the impermanent is established as permanent.

original: 'di la gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rtag pa mtshungs pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa mtshungs pa yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Permanence is the same, etc.

original: de la phyin ci log pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log pa nyid de /
translated: There, it is erroneous.

original: snga ma bzhin du med pa nyid med na rtag pa nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du med pa nyid med na rtag pa nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: As before, because the nonexistent is nonexistent, permanence is nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir zhes pa ni gang gi phyir de ltar thams cad la skyon thams cad sbyor te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa ni gang gi phyir de ltar thams cad la skyon thams cad sbyor te /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means: because all faults are applied to everything in that way,

original: de'i phyir ltag chod rnams su ma 'dres pas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ltag chod rnams su ma 'dres pas te /
translated: therefore, since they are not mixed up,

original: yul rnam par dbye bas phyin ci log la sogs pa'i skyon rnams brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul rnam par dbye bas phyin ci log la sogs pa'i skyon rnams brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: the faults of error, etc. cannot be expressed by distinguishing the objects.

original: rigs pa phrar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩrigs pa phra mor ksha y'a da yis brjod pa'i ltag chod rnams mtshan nyid skyon can nyid dang / lan byas pa nyid /
analyzed: rigs pa phrar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste / rigs pa phra mor ksha y'a da yis brjod pa'i ltag chod rnams mtshan nyid skyon can nyid dang / lan byas pa nyid /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in subtle reasoning‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyas par rigs pa brtag par shes par bya /
analyzed: rgyas par rigs pa brtag par shes par bya /
translated: The faults of the characteristics and the replies to the arguments expressed by the subtle reasoning of the KsÃ£anÃ£tikas are to be understood in detail in the Nyayapariccheda.

original: ci ste ma tha ra'i bu la sogs pas byas pa'i ltag chod rnams la ci ltar mtshan nyid dang lan skyon can nyid du shes par bya zhe na de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ste ma tha ra'i bu la sogs pas byas pa'i ltag chod rnams la ci ltar mtshan nyid dang lan skyon can nyid du shes par bya zhe na de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow are the faults of the characteristics and the replies to the arguments expressed by the arguments of the Materialists, etc. to be understood?‚Äù

original: phyogs des zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs des zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is said: ‚ÄúBy that position‚Äù and so on.

original: chos mthun pa nyid dang chos mi mthun pa nyid dag gis dgra zlar gnas pa zhes pa 'di rigs pa phra mor ltag chod thams cad kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos mthun pa nyid dang chos mi mthun pa nyid dag gis dgra zlar gnas pa zhes pa 'di rigs pa phra mor ltag chod thams cad kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey stand as adversaries through similarity and dissimilarity of properties‚Äù is the definition of all reductio arguments in subtle reasoning.

original: dgra zlar gnas te gang gis phyin ci log par gnas par byed pa de dod zlar gnas pa'i tshig ste ltag chod do //
analyzed: dgra zlar gnas te gang gis phyin ci log par gnas par byed pa de dod zlar gnas pa'i tshig ste ltag chod do //
translated: ‚ÄúThey stand as adversaries‚Äù means that they stand as opposites. This is the statement of the reductio.

original: de lta na ni chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa mtshungs pa gnyis po dag kho na ltag chod du 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na ni chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pa mtshungs pa gnyis po dag kho na ltag chod du 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, the two, similarity and dissimilarity of properties, would themselves be reductio arguments.‚Äù In response to this, it says:

original: de'i rnam par rtog pa las ltag chod mang po nyid du zhes pa /
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pa las ltag chod mang po nyid du zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom its conception, there are many reductio arguments.‚Äù

original: sgrub byed rnams la dod zlar gnas pa ni sbyor ba'i dbye ba @311b las rnam pa du ma ste /
analyzed: sgrub byed rnams la dod zlar gnas pa ni sbyor ba'i dbye ba @311b las rnam pa du ma ste /
translated: The adversaries of the proofs are of many types, due to the different types of syllogisms.

original: des na de'i bye brag du ma can nyid kyi phyir ltag chod rnams mang po nyid do //
analyzed: des na de'i bye brag du ma can nyid kyi phyir ltag chod rnams mang po nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because they have many different types, there are many reductio arguments.

original: de yang mtshan nyid 'di zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid 'di zhes pa la sogs pas mtshan nyid ma khyab pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, it says that the definition is not included in the definition, with ‚ÄúThat definition . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras mi skye ba mtshungs pa la sogs pa rnams gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras mi skye ba mtshungs pa la sogs pa rnams gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù are to be understood as including the similar non-arising, etc.

original: 'dir dpe brjod dang chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pas rtsod zlar gnas pa srid pa ma yin pas te /
analyzed: 'dir dpe brjod dang chos mthun pa dang chos mi mthun pas rtsod zlar gnas pa srid pa ma yin pas te /
translated: Here, the opponent‚Äôs position is not possible by way of either similarity or dissimilarity of example.

original: gtan tshigs med pa tsam du rtsod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs med pa tsam du rtsod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the argument is only about the absence of a reason.

original: ba lang nyid kyi phyir ba lang du grub pa bzhin grub po zhes pa chos mthun pa nyid dang chos mi mthun pa nyid mtshungs bdag gis lan te /üîΩji ltar ba lang nyid kyi phyir ba lang gi dngos po grub pa na khro ba nyid la sogs pa dang chos mi mthun pa nyid las de ldog pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa nyid du grub na /
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyi phyir ba lang du grub pa bzhin grub po zhes pa chos mthun pa nyid dang chos mi mthun pa nyid mtshungs bdag gis lan te / ji ltar ba lang nyid kyi phyir ba lang gi dngos po grub pa na khro ba nyid la sogs pa dang chos mi mthun pa nyid las de ldog pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa nyid du grub na /
translated: The response is that the establishment is similar by way of similarity and dissimilarity of attributes, like the establishment of a cow by way of cowness.

original: bum pa dang chos mi mthun pa nyid las lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang chos mi mthun pa nyid las lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir de ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as when the entity of a cow is established by way of cowness, it is not excluded by way of dissimilarity, such as by way of fierceness, in the same way, when impermanence is established by way of similarity, it is not excluded by way of dissimilarity, such as by way of being non-embodiment.

original: chos mthun pa nyid mtshungs pa la ni bzlog pas sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos mthun pa nyid mtshungs pa la ni bzlog pas sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: In the case of a similar property, the opposite is applied.

original: ji ltar khra bo nyid la sogs pa dang chos mi mthun pa nyid las khyad par grub na /
analyzed: ji ltar khra bo nyid la sogs pa dang chos mi mthun pa nyid las khyad par grub na /
translated: Just as impermanence is established by dissimilar properties such as being variegated,

original: ba lang nyid du chos mthun pa las de ldog pa ma yin pa de ltar rtag pa dang / chos mi mthun pa nyid las dbang pos gzung bya nyid las mi rtag pa nyid grub pa na /
analyzed: ba lang nyid du chos mthun pa las de ldog pa ma yin pa de ltar rtag pa dang / chos mi mthun pa nyid las dbang pos gzung bya nyid las mi rtag pa nyid grub pa na /
translated: if impermanence is established by dissimilar properties such as being perceptible by the sense faculties, then just as impermanence is not negated by the similar property of being an animal,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa dang / chos mthun pa nyid las lus can ma yin pa nyid las de ldog pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa dang / chos mthun pa nyid las lus can ma yin pa nyid las de ldog pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: nonembodiment is not negated by the similar property of being space, etc.üîΩThis is also not a response because, having accepted that impermanence is established by similar and dissimilar properties, you say, ‚ÄúDo not contradict your own assertion!‚Äù and then negate it.

original: 'di yang lan ma yin te gang gi phyir 'di ni chos mthun pa dang / chos mi mthun pa dag las mi rtag pa nyid 'grub par khas blangs nas khas blangs 'gal bar ma gyur cig ces pas bzlog pa las ldog par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang lan ma yin te gang gi phyir 'di ni chos mthun pa dang / chos mi mthun pa dag las mi rtag pa nyid 'grub par khas blangs nas khas blangs 'gal bar ma gyur cig ces pas bzlog pa las ldog par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But you do not negate it by reversing it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat do you do?‚Äù

original: 'di kho na mtshungs par dgra zlar gnas pa las mi 'grub bo zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'di kho na mtshungs par dgra zlar gnas pa las mi 'grub bo zhes smras pa'o //
translated: It is not established by the mere similarity of the property of the thesis and the reason.

original: bzlog pa la mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir yang lan ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa la mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir yang lan ma yin no //
translated: The response is not correct, because the reversal is the same.

original: 'di la ltag chod smra ba bos brjod par nus te /
analyzed: 'di la ltag chod smra ba bos brjod par nus te /
translated: Here, the proponent of the reductio can respond:

original: gal te khyed kyi chos mthun pa nyid dang chos mi mthun pa nyid tsam las mi rtag pa nyid 'grub na /
analyzed: gal te khyed kyi chos mthun pa nyid dang chos mi mthun pa nyid tsam las mi rtag pa nyid 'grub na /
translated: If impermanence is established for you from the mere similarity and dissimilarity of properties,

original: de ltar gyur na da'i yang 'grub po zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na da'i yang 'grub po zhes so //
translated: then that also is established.

original: de'i phyir 'di la rnam pa gzhan du lan brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la rnam pa gzhan du lan brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the response should be stated in a different way.

original: sogs pa smos pa las 'phel ba dang 'grib pa mtshungs pa la sogs pa rnams ki /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa las 'phel ba dang 'grib pa mtshungs pa la sogs pa rnams ki /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes similarity of increase and decrease, and so on.

original: cung zad chos mthun pa las nye bar bsdu ba 'grub pa'i phyir /üîΩ@312a * // chos mi mthun pa las dod zlar mi gnas pa zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: cung zad chos mthun pa las nye bar bsdu ba 'grub pa'i phyir / @312a * // chos mi mthun pa las dod zlar mi gnas pa zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: Because the establishment of the inclusion of the similar instance is by virtue of the mere similarity of properties,üîΩthe establishment of the inclusion of the dissimilar instance is by virtue of the mere dissimilarity of properties.

original: cung zad chos mthun pa nyid la nye bar sdud pa 'grub pa mthong ste /
analyzed: cung zad chos mthun pa nyid la nye bar sdud pa 'grub pa mthong ste /
translated: The inclusion of the similar instance is seen to be established by virtue of the mere similarity of properties.

original: ba lang ji lta ba de ltar ba men no zhes so //üîΩba lang gi chos rnams thams cad ba men la'am /
analyzed: ba lang ji lta ba de ltar ba men no zhes so // ba lang gi chos rnams thams cad ba men la'am /
translated: Just as a cow is, so is a gayal.üîΩAll the properties of a cow are not obtained in a gayal,

original: ba men gyi chos rnams ba lang la 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba men gyi chos rnams ba lang la 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: nor are all the properties of a gayal obtained in a cow.üîΩTherefore, this reductio is not entailed.

original: de'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba 'di ma yin no zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams thams cad mi rigs pa nyid du rigs pa brtag pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba 'di ma yin no zhes pa 'di lta bu la sogs pa rnams thams cad mi rigs pa nyid du rigs pa brtag pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: All of these should be understood in the same way as they are explained in the Vigrahavyiivartani.

original: de bzhin du bstan bcos gzhan du byas pa'i ltag chod dang lan rnams la yang dgag pa'i ched du /
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan bcos gzhan du byas pa'i ltag chod dang lan rnams la yang dgag pa'i ched du /
translated: In the same way, in order to refute the objections and responses made in other treatises,

original: gang rigs pa brtag par bstan pa 'di kho na phyogs tsam ste /
analyzed: gang rigs pa brtag par bstan pa 'di kho na phyogs tsam ste /
translated: a mere portion of the argumentation of the Vigrahavyiivartani is presented here.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyang phyogs 'di kho nas dgag bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyang phyogs 'di kho nas dgag bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those should be refuted by this very method.

original: rigs ba brtag pa la sogs pa rnams su gzhal bya dgag pa byas par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rigs ba brtag pa la sogs pa rnams su gzhal bya dgag pa byas par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the object of refutation refuted in the Vigrahavyiivartani and so on,

original: 'di yang don gyis byas pa'o zhes ston pa gsungs pa thams cad kyi yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang don gyis byas pa'o zhes ston pa gsungs pa thams cad kyi yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: but this is also done implicitly.

original: ci'i phyir mngon sum gyi rtogs par bya bar mi 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mngon sum gyi rtogs par bya bar mi 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: des yongs su brtag pa'i tshig gi don rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: des yongs su brtag pa'i tshig gi don rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe referents of the words that are investigated by it‚Äù and so forth.

original: gtso bo dang skyes bu dang phyogs dang dus dang 'phrad pa 'du ba la sogs pa rnams mngon sum yin pa nyid kyis na rtags kyis yod pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rtog gis rtogs par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gtso bo dang skyes bu dang phyogs dang dus dang 'phrad pa 'du ba la sogs pa rnams mngon sum yin pa nyid kyis na rtags kyis yod pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rtog gis rtogs par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Since the primary principle, the person, directions, time, contact, conjunction, and so forth are direct perception itself, they are posited as existent by means of a reason. Therefore, they are to be understood by thought.

original: brtag bzod pa ma yin no zhes pa rnam par dpyad par mi bzod do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: brtag bzod pa ma yin no zhes pa rnam par dpyad par mi bzod do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are not able to withstand analysis‚Äù means they are not able to withstand investigation.

original: ji ltar dpyad bzod pa ma yin pa de ltar yang bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar dpyad bzod pa ma yin pa de ltar yang bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Just as they are not able to withstand analysis, this has already been proven.

original: de'i phyir zhes pa gang gi phyir rtog ge ni brtag par bzod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir des rtogs par bya ba'i gzhal bya yang don gyis dgag pa 'dir byas pa kho nar rig par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa gang gi phyir rtog ge ni brtag par bzod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir des rtogs par bya ba'i gzhal bya yang don gyis dgag pa 'dir byas pa kho nar rig par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because reasoning is not able to withstand investigation, therefore the object of comprehension that is to be understood by it is also implicitly refuted here. This is what should be understood.

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bya byed dga' ba nyid kyis zhes pa la sogs pas bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa can ston to //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bya byed dga' ba nyid kyis zhes pa la sogs pas bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa can ston to //
translated: The purpose of composing the treatise is taught by because of the delight in valid knowledge and the objects of valid knowledge, and so on.

original: sngar tshad ma 'grub pa ni dngos kyi dngos par brjod cing /
analyzed: sngar tshad ma 'grub pa ni dngos kyi dngos par brjod cing /
translated: Previously, the establishment of valid knowledge was stated as the actual purpose.

original: 'di ni brgyud pas so ;üîΩ/'o na phyin ci ma log pa'i lam nye bar ston pa las /
analyzed: 'di ni brgyud pas so ; /'o na phyin ci ma log pa'i lam nye bar ston pa las /
translated: This is the indirect purpose.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i don can du yang 'di rtsom pa 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rjes su 'jug pa'i don can du yang 'di rtsom pa 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Well, isn't this composition also undertaken for the purpose of engaging in the teachings of the TathƒÅgata by demonstrating the unmistaken path?

original: de ltar ni mig dri ma med pa nyid du ba sgrubs pa na gzugs kyang phyin ci ma log par don gyis nye bar bstan par @312b 'gyur ba ji lta ba de ltar tshad ma bye brag tu rtogs par byas pa na /
analyzed: de ltar ni mig dri ma med pa nyid du ba sgrubs pa na gzugs kyang phyin ci ma log par don gyis nye bar bstan par @312b 'gyur ba ji lta ba de ltar tshad ma bye brag tu rtogs par byas pa na /
translated: Just as when establishing the eye as stainless, form is also unmistakenly demonstrated as the object, in the same way, when valid knowledge is specifically understood,

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid la rjes su 'jug pa'i lam yang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid la rjes su 'jug pa'i lam yang ngo zhe na /
translated: the path of engaging in the unmistaken reality is also [understood].

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di tsam gyis ni ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is not merely this, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsungs pa / de'i chos ni rtog ge'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / de'i chos ni rtog ge'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes so //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúBecause its Dharma is not the domain of logic.‚Äù

original: rtog ge smos pa ni tha snyad pa'i tshad ma nye bar mtshon pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: rtog ge smos pa ni tha snyad pa'i tshad ma nye bar mtshon pa'i don du ste /
translated: The mention of logic is for the purpose of illustrating conventional valid cognition.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa kho na'i tshad ma'i yul bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa kho na'i tshad ma'i yul bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The Dharma of the BhagavƒÅn, the domain of only supramundane valid cognition, is to be known by oneself.

original: tha snyad pa'i ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is not the domain of conventional valid cognition.

original: gal te de ltar na ci log pa de rnams kyis gal te log kyang chos nyid mi rtogs sam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na ci log pa de rnams kyis gal te log kyang chos nyid mi rtogs sam zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then if those who are mistaken do not realize reality even if they are mistaken,

original: de'i phyir gsung pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsung pa /
translated: then why is it said:

original: log pa rnams ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: log pa rnams ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are mistaken‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: ma log pa rnams ni de kho na la snying por lta ba nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa nyan par yang mi sgro zhing /
analyzed: ma log pa rnams ni de kho na la snying por lta ba nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa nyan par yang mi sgro zhing /
translated: Those who are not mistaken, because they view reality as the essence, do not listen to the teachings of the TathƒÅgata.

original: log pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la gang chod rnams kyi chos nyid yongs su gsal bar byas pa de thos pa dang bsam pa dang yang dag par bsgom pa'i rim pas 'bad pa med pa kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la gang chod rnams kyi chos nyid yongs su gsal bar byas pa de thos pa dang bsam pa dang yang dag par bsgom pa'i rim pas 'bad pa med pa kho nar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perverse, when they hear the teaching of the TathƒÅgata, will understand it without effort through the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation, because the reality of all things is revealed.

original: chos nyid ni chos rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: chos nyid ni chos rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Reality is the undistorted nature of things.

original: de kho na nyid ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir mu stegs pa'i lugs thos par byas kyang chos nyid mi rtogs ki /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mu stegs pa'i lugs thos par byas kyang chos nyid mi rtogs ki /
translated: Why, when one hears the non-Buddhist systems, does one not understand reality?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa thos nas rtogs she na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa thos nas rtogs she na /
translated: But when one hears the teaching of the TathƒÅgata, one does understand it?

original: gsungs pa / bar shin tu ring ba'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / bar shin tu ring ba'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is very far away.‚Äù

original: de yang legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de yang legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Moreover, it is because of the good and the bad.

original: thub pa'i dbang po'i bstan pa ni legs par byas pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po'i bstan pa ni legs par byas pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the Lord of Sages is good.

original: der chos rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / mu stegs pa'i lugs ni nyes par byas pa ste bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der chos rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / mu stegs pa'i lugs ni nyes par byas pa ste bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it illuminates the nature of things, such as the non-erroneous selflessness, and because the non-Buddhist systems are faulty and are to be refuted.

original: de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa la brten pa kho nas de kho na nyid rtogs bar 'gyur gyi cig shos kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa la brten pa kho nas de kho na nyid rtogs bar 'gyur gyi cig shos kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, reality is realized only by relying on the teaching of the Sugata, not by any other means.

original: bar shin tu ring ba nyid kho nar bstan pa'i ched du tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bar shin tu ring ba nyid kho nar bstan pa'i ched du tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach that the distance between the two is very great, a verse is stated:

original: rtog ge tsam stobs can rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtog ge tsam stobs can rnams zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are strong in mere speculation‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: rtog ge tsam gyi skyabs can ni mu stegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: rtog ge tsam gyi skyabs can ni mu stegs pa rnams te /
translated: Those who are protected by mere speculation are the non-Buddhists.

original: don gang rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin @313a * //
analyzed: don gang rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin @313a * //
translated: The nature of things is not realized by them,

original: rtogs pa las 'ba' zhig pa nyid thos par 'gyur ba bdag la sogs pa de rnams rtog ge tsam las rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa las 'ba' zhig pa nyid thos par 'gyur ba bdag la sogs pa de rnams rtog ge tsam las rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they realize only what is heard, such as the self, through mere speculation.

original: 'o na khyod kyi yang bdag med pa nyid rtog ges rtogs par bya ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi yang bdag med pa nyid rtog ges rtogs par bya ba kho na ste /
translated: Well then, in your case, the selflessness that is to be realized is also just what is to be realized by reasoning.

original: des na 'di la khyad par ci zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na 'di la khyad par ci zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: So what is the difference between the two?

original: de yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat also . . .‚Äù

original: gang phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid de ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid de ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the unmistaken definition has not been taught,

original: mtshan nyid ma bstan cing ngo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma bstan cing ngo //
translated: the definition has not been taught.

original: rang gi sbyor ba dang 'gal ba yang ste rang nyid kyi ba kho na'i sbyor ba dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi sbyor ba dang 'gal ba yang ste rang nyid kyi ba kho na'i sbyor ba dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: It also contradicts your own application, that is, it contradicts your own application alone.

original: de ltar ni grangs can pa rnams kyi ni 'brel pa gcig las mngon sum las lhag ma 'grub pa'o zhes pa rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar ni grangs can pa rnams kyi ni 'brel pa gcig las mngon sum las lhag ma 'grub pa'o zhes pa rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition of inference for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is that it is the establishment of the remainder from the perception of one relation.

original: sbyor ba ni gtso bo yod de khyad par rnams la rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gtso bo yod de khyad par rnams la rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The application is, ‚ÄúThe primary nature exists because the particulars are seen to be subsequent to it.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ni gtso bo dang yod pa ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba ni gtso bo dang yod pa ni ma yin pas so //
translated: The seeing of the subsequent is not seen in the primary nature and existence.

original: bye brag par nams kyi yang 'di'i 'di 'bras bu dang rgyu'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bye brag par nams kyi yang 'di'i 'di 'bras bu dang rgyu'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad pa ni /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that the nature of inference is the cognition of a property of the subject through the sign of the effect and the sign of the cause.

original: de'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dang 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir sgra mi rtag go zhes pa la sogs pa'i rang gi sbyor ba dang 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dang 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir sgra mi rtag go zhes pa la sogs pa'i rang gi sbyor ba dang 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not related to one‚Äôs own syllogism, such as ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because of being a product‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i 'brel pa rnams kyi gang yang rung ba yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa'i 'brel pa rnams kyi gang yang rung ba yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for any of the relations explained to exist.

original: gal te yang ci zhig ltar yang rang gi sbyor ba dang 'brel pa de lta na yang skyon dang ldan pa kho na'o zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te yang ci zhig ltar yang rang gi sbyor ba dang 'brel pa de lta na yang skyon dang ldan pa kho na'o zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: Even if it were somehow related to one‚Äôs own syllogism, it would still be faulty. To demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'dod don sgrub par byed pa'ang min //
analyzed: 'dod don sgrub par byed pa'ang min //
translated: It does not accomplish the desired aim.

original: zhes pa'o // ji ltar sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar don dam pa bdun cu pa la sogs pa rnams su dang 'dir yang bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // ji ltar sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar don dam pa bdun cu pa la sogs pa rnams su dang 'dir yang bstan to //
translated: How it does not accomplish the desired aim is explained in the ultimate sense in the Seventy and so on and here.

original: ches ring nyams pa rnams zhes pa lam gol ba la zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ches ring nyams pa rnams zhes pa lam gol ba la zhugs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Those who are very far from the degeneration of the Dharma are those who have entered the wrong path.

original: gang zhig rtog ge'i lam gyis chos nyid rnam par nges par byed pa de rnams ni thub dbang bstan las ches ring nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rtog ge'i lam gyis chos nyid rnam par nges par byed pa de rnams ni thub dbang bstan las ches ring nyams pa yin te /
translated: Those who determine reality by the path of reasoning are very far from the teaching of the Lord of Sages,

original: de rtog ge'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtog ge'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that is not the domain of reasoning.

original: gal te yang 'di de ltar yin pa de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ni gal te rnam par 'gyur bar 'gro bar byed na brtag par gyis /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di de ltar yin pa de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ni gal te rnam par 'gyur bar 'gro bar byed na brtag par gyis /
translated: Even if this is so, if the characteristics of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs Dharma are taken to be something that can be transformed, then let us examine that.

original: mu stegs pas brtags pa'i tsheg gi don bzhin no //
analyzed: mu stegs pas brtags pa'i tsheg gi don bzhin no //
translated: It is like the meaning of the atom imagined by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: mu stegs pa rnams kyis rtog ge'i yul nyid du khas blangs pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams kyang @313b rtog ges rnam par dpyad na rnam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu stegs pa rnams kyis rtog ge'i yul nyid du khas blangs pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i tshig gi don rnams kyang @313b rtog ges rnam par dpyad na rnam par 'gyur te /
translated: The meanings of words such as self, which are accepted as the domain of reasoning by the tƒ´rthikas, are transformed when analyzed by reasoning.

original: bstan bcos su de rnams ji ltar rnam par gzhag par byas pa de ltar mi gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bstan bcos su de rnams ji ltar rnam par gzhag par byas pa de ltar mi gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The treatise states that they do not abide in the way they are posited.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu rig par mdzad pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa bdag med pa la sogs pa ni rnam par dpyad pa na rnam par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu rig par mdzad pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa bdag med pa la sogs pa ni rnam par dpyad pa na rnam par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of the phenomena that the TathƒÅgata causes to be known, such as selflessness, is not altered when analyzed.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du tha snyad pa'i bdag nyid kyis de lta kho nar nye bar dmigs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du tha snyad pa'i bdag nyid kyis de lta kho nar nye bar dmigs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as they are taught, they are observed in just that way by the conventional nature.

original: 'dis ni gal te yang rtog ge don dam pa'i yul can du mi 'gyur ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te yang rtog ge don dam pa'i yul can du mi 'gyur ba de lta na yang /
translated: This clarifies that, although reasoning does not become the subject of the ultimate,

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po spyi'i tshul gyis gsal bar byed cing de kho na nyid rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro zhes gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i dngos po spyi'i tshul gyis gsal bar byed cing de kho na nyid rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro zhes gsal bar byas so //
translated: it clarifies that it illuminates things as they are by means of the general mode of being and is in accord with the realization of thatness.

original: tshad ma'i phung po'i zhes pa /
analyzed: tshad ma'i phung po'i zhes pa /
translated: The treatise states, ‚ÄúThe Collection of Valid Knowledge . . .‚Äù

original: rang dang pha rol po mngon par 'dod pa'i tshad ma rnams kyi phung po ste tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang pha rol po mngon par 'dod pa'i tshad ma rnams kyi phung po ste tshogs pa'o //
translated: The collection of one's own and the opponent's valid cognitions.

original: rang mngon par 'dod pa'i chad ma rnams rnam par 'jog cing pha rol po mngon par 'dod pa rnams sun 'byin par byed do zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: rang mngon par 'dod pa'i chad ma rnams rnam par 'jog cing pha rol po mngon par 'dod pa rnams sun 'byin par byed do zhes byas nas so //
translated: Having established one's own valid cognitions and refuted the opponent's valid cognitions.

original: de la rang mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi yon tan rnams dang / pha rol po rnams kyi skyon rnams te //
analyzed: de la rang mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi yon tan rnams dang / pha rol po rnams kyi skyon rnams te //
translated: There, the qualities of one's own and the faults of the opponent.

original: de rnams rgyas pa ni yon tan skyon rgyas pa'o //üîΩde rtogs par byed pa ni brtsad pa dang bcas pa'i lan gyi gzhung gi phung po'o //
analyzed: de rnams rgyas pa ni yon tan skyon rgyas pa'o // de rtogs par byed pa ni brtsad pa dang bcas pa'i lan gyi gzhung gi phung po'o //
translated: The expansion of those is the expansion of qualities and faults.

original: de gsal bar byas las gang dag ba ste //
analyzed: de gsal bar byas las gang dag ba ste //
translated: That which causes the realization of that is the collection of texts of replies with debate.üîΩThat which clarifies that is the collection of texts of replies without debate.

original: bsod nams bdag gis bsags pa ste //
analyzed: bsod nams bdag gis bsags pa ste //
translated: The merit that I have accumulated

original: nye bar bsags ba des te dge ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsags ba des te dge ba'o //
translated: by that, which is virtuous,

original: 'jig rten gyi rnam thar te mya ngan las 'das pa dang skye ba ni 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rnam thar te mya ngan las 'das pa dang skye ba ni 'byung ba ste /
translated: the liberation of the world, nirvana, will arise.

original: de dag gi yon tan yon tan min bdag ste yon tan dang skyon dag go //
analyzed: de dag gi yon tan yon tan min bdag ste yon tan dang skyon dag go //
translated: Their virtues and non-virtues are the virtues and faults.

original: de shes par gyur pa'i mthar byas zhi ba'i ched du shog ste byur cag pa'o //
analyzed: de shes par gyur pa'i mthar byas zhi ba'i ched du shog ste byur cag pa'o //
translated: May I be at the end of knowing them, for the sake of peace, i.e., for the sake of nirvana.

original: thar pa'i yon tan shes pa'i dang skye ba la skyon shes pa'i yang zhes 'di sgrub pa yin gyi rjes su rjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thar pa'i yon tan shes pa'i dang skye ba la skyon shes pa'i yang zhes 'di sgrub pa yin gyi rjes su rjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is the establishment of the knowledge of the virtues of liberation and the knowledge of the faults of birth, and not a mere repetition,

original: gzhan du ni nyi tshe ba'i yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni nyi tshe ba'i yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise it would be a partial dedication.

original: thar pa dang skye ba dag gi yon tan dang yon tan ma yin pa shes par gyur pa ni mthar byas zhi ba thob par gyur cig ces pa ngag gi don to //
analyzed: thar pa dang skye ba dag gi yon tan dang yon tan ma yin pa shes par gyur pa ni mthar byas zhi ba thob par gyur cig ces pa ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is: May I be at the end of knowing the virtues and non-virtues of liberation and birth, i.e., may I attain peace, i.e., nirvana.

original: mthar byas ni phyin ci log bzhi'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: mthar byas ni phyin ci log bzhi'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The end is characterized by the four errors.

original: gang phyir des thar pa'i gags nyid kyis 'gro ba mtha' ste yongs mthar byas te /
analyzed: gang phyir des thar pa'i gags nyid kyis 'gro ba mtha' ste yongs mthar byas te /
translated: Because by that, the end, i.e., the totality, of beings is made, by the very obstruction to liberation,

original: bdag la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gis rab tu bsgos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gis rab tu bsgos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is thoroughly imbued with the errors of self, etc.

original: khor ba'i sdug bsngal mtha' dag zad pa'i ngo bo ni ldog pa ste de zhi ba'o zhes pa'o //üîΩgang @314a * //
analyzed: khor ba'i sdug bsngal mtha' dag zad pa'i ngo bo ni ldog pa ste de zhi ba'o zhes pa'o // gang @314a * //
translated: The essence of the cessation of all the sufferings of samsara is the opposite of that, i.e., peace.üîΩThe treatise composed by this Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ himself, which is the source of all the treatises of the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, is the Root Verses on the Middle Way.

original: la 'jam pa'i dpal 'dis rang nyid kyis ni rjes su yang dag byung gang de las 'gro bas de kho na nyid rtogs gyur tshad ma 'grub pa'i ched du mdzad pa'i bstan bcos gang yin de //
analyzed: la 'jam pa'i dpal 'dis rang nyid kyis ni rjes su yang dag byung gang de las 'gro bas de kho na nyid rtogs gyur tshad ma 'grub pa'i ched du mdzad pa'i bstan bcos gang yin de //
translated: The treatise composed by him for the sake of establishing valid knowledge, from which the world will come to understand reality, is the Drop of Reasoning.

original: kun nas phye ste rgyal ba'i dbang po'i blo ltar de nyid don can bshad pa 'di byas las //
analyzed: kun nas phye ste rgyal ba'i dbang po'i blo ltar de nyid don can bshad pa 'di byas las //
translated: I have explained the meaning of reality in this treatise, which is like the mind of the lord of victors, in a way that is clear to all.üîΩMay the virtue that has arisen from this be for the realization of reality by all beings.

original: bdag la dge ba yang dag byung gang de las 'gro bas de kho na nyid rtogs gyur cig / ces pa yangs pa dang dri ma med pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad //
analyzed: bdag la dge ba yang dag byung gang de las 'gro bas de kho na nyid rtogs gyur cig / ces pa yangs pa dang dri ma med pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel bshad //
translated: This commentary on the Compendium of Valid Knowledge is called Vast and Stainless.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yul ba slob dpon rgyal ba'i dbang po'i blo gros kyi zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yul ba slob dpon rgyal ba'i dbang po'i blo gros kyi zhabs kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: It was composed by the bodhisattva, the master Jina‚Äôs Mind, the one with the feet of wisdom. It is complete.

original: // / shlo ka stong phrag dgu pa'o zhes rgyang pa'i mjug tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: // / shlo ka stong phrag dgu pa'o zhes rgyang pa'i mjug tu 'byung ngo //
translated: The colophon says, ‚ÄúThe ninth thousand.‚Äù

original: tshul 'di ni chos kyi rje shong ston lo ts'a ba rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyis legs par bshad pa'i srol la sogs pa la brten nas legs par sbyar ba brda sprod pa'i tshul la blo'i snang ba cher rgyas pa /
analyzed: tshul 'di ni chos kyi rje shong ston lo ts'a ba rdo rje rgyal mtshan gyis legs par bshad pa'i srol la sogs pa la brten nas legs par sbyar ba brda sprod pa'i tshul la blo'i snang ba cher rgyas pa /
translated: This was well composed by the lord of dharma, the translator from Sho, Dorj√© Gyaltsen, based on the tradition of good explanations and so forth, and the light of his mind greatly expanded in the way of grammar.

original: dbang lo ts'a ba dge slong dpal ldan blo gros bstan pas /
analyzed: dbang lo ts'a ba dge slong dpal ldan blo gros bstan pas /
translated: The translator from Wang, the monk Palden Lodr√∂ Tenpa,

original: pandi ta la ma ltos par rang nyid kyis rgya dpe la bltas nas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta la ma ltos par rang nyid kyis rgya dpe la bltas nas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: without relying on a pa·πá·∏çita, looked at the Indian text himself, translated it, edited it, and finalized it.üîΩThe door of the temple of the doctrine of the glorious Victorious One, which is endowed with the treasure of benefit and happiness, is opened.

original: // / dpal ldan rgyal ba'i dbang po'i bstan pa'i khang bzangs phan bde'i mdzod ldan dam pa'i sgo 'phar ma cho ga / dpal ldan phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung lugs rang gi sde pas brtags pa'i rtog gi ngan sel zhing //
analyzed: // / dpal ldan rgyal ba'i dbang po'i bstan pa'i khang bzangs phan bde'i mdzod ldan dam pa'i sgo 'phar ma cho ga / dpal ldan phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung lugs rang gi sde pas brtags pa'i rtog gi ngan sel zhing //
translated: The field that clears away the bad thoughts of our own Buddhist schools is the scriptural tradition of the glorious DignƒÅga.

original: rgyal ba rgyal dpog rkang mig gzegs zan ser skya 'jig rten mig gi rjes su 'jug rnams kyi //
analyzed: rgyal ba rgyal dpog rkang mig gzegs zan ser skya 'jig rten mig gi rjes su 'jug rnams kyi //
translated: The followers of the eye of the world, the Jina, Kanada, Ak·π£apƒÅda, Ka·πáƒÅda, and Kapila,

original: rtog ge ngan pa rmeg med byed de'i 'grel bshad mchog 'di sngon med bsgyur cing zhu chen byas //
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa rmeg med byed de'i 'grel bshad mchog 'di sngon med bsgyur cing zhu chen byas //
translated: are destroyed by this supreme commentary, which was never before translated or revised.

original: gzhung 'grel 'grel bshad bcas pa rnams //
analyzed: gzhung 'grel 'grel bshad bcas pa rnams //
translated: The texts, the commentaries, and the subcommentaries,

original: tshig brling don yang gting dpag dka' //
analyzed: tshig brling don yang gting dpag dka' //
translated: are difficult to fathom, with their deep meanings and their difficult words.

original: de slad legs par rab 'bad kyang //
analyzed: de slad legs par rab 'bad kyang //
translated: Therefore, even if one strives well,

original: 'di la 'khrul med shin tu dkon //
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul med shin tu dkon //
translated: it is very rare to be without error in this.

original: 'phags blo ma thob blo gros skyon //
analyzed: 'phags blo ma thob blo gros skyon //
translated: The fault of the mind is not obtaining the mind of the noble ones.

original: rnam g-yeng le lo sbyor ba'i skyon //
analyzed: rnam g-yeng le lo sbyor ba'i skyon //
translated: The fault of application is distraction and laziness.

original: mkhas las mthos skal ba'i skyon //
analyzed: mkhas las mthos skal ba'i skyon //
translated: The fault of fortune is being more learned than the wise.

original: 'di yi skyon ldan bzod par mdzod //
analyzed: 'di yi skyon ldan bzod par mdzod //
translated: Please forgive the faults in this.

original: blo mchog sbyor ba rab rgyas shing //
analyzed: blo mchog sbyor ba rab rgyas shing //
translated: Those with the best minds, with the most extensive application,

original: gzu bor gnas pa'i dge mtshan ldan //
analyzed: gzu bor gnas pa'i dge mtshan ldan //
translated: with the auspicious marks of being honest,

original: legs bshad don gnyer dus skabs can //
analyzed: legs bshad don gnyer dus skabs can //
translated: with the opportunity to strive for the meaning of the well-explained teachings,

original: de rnams rigs pa'i dga' ston mdzod //
analyzed: de rnams rigs pa'i dga' ston mdzod //
translated: they should enjoy the feast of reasoning.

original: 'dir 'bad dge bas 'gro ba kun //
analyzed: 'dir 'bad dge bas 'gro ba kun //
translated: By the virtue of striving in this, may all beings

original: rigs pa dam pa'i dpung bsags te //
analyzed: rigs pa dam pa'i dpung bsags te //
translated: gather the army of the holy reasoning

original: bdud dang mu stegs kun bcom nas //
analyzed: bdud dang mu stegs kun bcom nas //
translated: Having conquered all demons and extremists,

original: rgyal ba'i dbang po myur thob shog //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dbang po myur thob shog //
translated: may I quickly attain the state of a victorious one.
